place.name: BELCHAMP ST PAUL
place.gazetteerText: BELCHAMP-ST. PAUL, a parish in the district of Sudbury and county of Essex; on the river Stour, 6 miles WNW of Sudbury r. station. It has a post office under Sudbury, and a fair on 11 Dec. Acres, 2,557. Real property, £4,209. Pop., 832. Houses, 179. The property is divided among a few. The parish is a meet for the East Essex hounds. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Rochester. Value, £240.* Patrons, the Dean and Chapter of St. Paul's. The church is very good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
